classRec.name: BaseAnnotation
classRec.description:
This is the base class for all annotations. It implements the most
basic contract, IAnnotation, and offers the means of retrieving the
metadata attributes and their values from the type descriptor. This
information is passed inthe constructor via a MetaDescriptor object
and one must override the protected methd parse in order to apply
the necesary attributes on their own annotations. This mechanism
makes the annotations to not require direct access to the xml
descriptor of the type being introspected.
classRec.author: Alexutz

method.name: parse
method.description:
Analyze field/class descriptor to extract base informations like field's name and type.
Override this method in subclasses to add custom parsing of values extracted from the
annotation via the MetaDescriptor instance.
method.param:
descriptor MetaDescriptor instance holding the key-value pairs of existing attributes
and their values as present in the metadata instrospection

method.name: setVersion
method.description: Set the version of the current annotation

interfaceRec.name: IMemberAnnotation
interfaceRec.description:
This contact interface defines the structure of a member annotation,
that is, an annotation that is used only on class fields. A basic
member annotation has a reference to its parent class annotation,
has an access type (read, write, read/write) and can be ignored in
one of the two stages of the engine's processing: serialization or
deserialization.
interfaceRec.author: Alexutz

method.name: accessor
method.description: Get the field accessor

method.name: classAnnotation
method.description: Get a reference to the parent class annotation

method.name: ignoreOn
method.description:
Flag signaling whether the member annotation must be ignored in a
specific processing stage or not.

method.name: isIDRef
method.description:
Flag used to signal if the current field's values are id references to objects
in the same document.
method.return: true if id referencing is on, false otherwise

method.name: order
method.description:
Get the order value of the current annotation. This value is used of the
owner class annotation has its ordered flag set to true.

method.name: readOnly
method.description:
Get a flag signaling whether the field can be accesed in read only mode
(only has a getter)
method.return: true if is in read only mode, false otherwise

method.name: writeOnly
method.description:
Get a flag signaling whether the field can be accesed in write only mode
(only has a setter)
method.return: true if is in write only mode, false otherwise

interfaceRec.name: IGlobalAnnotation
interfaceRec.description:
This interface describes a metadata defined at class level, that is bound
to the class owner metadata but defines particularities specific to the
class itself. Good examples to this end are constructor arguments metadata
or namespaces used by the class fields. They are not bound to a field name
and type but they afect the class representation.
This kind of annotations does not usually need a serializer.
interfaceRec.author: Alexutz

method.name: classAnnotation
method.description: Get a reference to the parent class annotation

classRec.name: ConstructorArgument
classRec.description:
Defines a constructor argument. This annotaton is used when a class has a non default constructor. In order to maintain the business restrictions, FlexXB will determine the values of the arguments based on the received xml and call the constructor with those values.

An argument has a reference; the reference is the name of the class field whose value it represents. A non default constructor will most often configure some of the object's fields when called. Since the only available data is the incoming xml, arguments must specify the field the the constructor will modify with the received value.

The class field referenced in the argument must have an annotation defined for it
classRec.author: Alexutz

method.name: ConstructorArgument
method.description: Constructor

method.name: optional
method.description: Get optional flag

method.name: referenceField
method.description: the reference field name

interfaceRec.name: IClassAnnotation
interfaceRec.description:
This is the contract interface for a class annotation. A class annotation
holds all the annotation structure relevant for that type, being the
FlexXB's representation of the type. This representation is used in the
(de)serialization process so the engine will know how to generate and
parse xml.
interfaceRec.author: Alexutz

method.name: getMember
method.description: Get a member by field name
method.return: Member annotation instance if the field has member metadata defined, null otherwise

method.name: constructor
method.description:
Get a reference to the constructor object which defines the parameters the type constructor takes
(default or non-default constructor)

method.name: idField
method.description:
Get a reference to a field which is considered the identifier for instances of the specified
type. The ID field is used if one wishes to render objects of the current type in a short form,
consisting only in the type representation wrapper and the representation of this idField. By
this id field, upon deserialization, the engine can identify and extract the correct instance
from a model object cache.
method.return: Member annotation instance if idField has been defined, null otherwise

method.name: members
method.description: Get the list of members associated with this class

method.name: ordered
method.description: Get a flag signaling whether the members must be ordered by an integer value or not
method.return: true if the content is ordered, false otherwise

classRec.name: Configuration
classRec.description:
This class defines the settings the FlexXB Core and serialization contexts accept in
order to control processing. You may override this class to add more settings that
will be used in your serialization contexts and serializers.
classRec.author: Alexutz

method.name: Configuration
method.description: Constructor

method.name: clone
method.description: Clone the current configuration object
method.return: exact copy of the current object

method.name: copyFrom
method.description:
Copy the settings from a configuration instance to another. Override
this method in subclasses to specify additional settings to be copied.

method.name: getInstance
method.description:
Get a new instance of the Configuration object. It is used by the clone method to create and populate a copy of this.
Override this method to specify subclass instance.

method.name: allowCaching
method.description:
Flag signaling the presence or not of a cache provider. It is a
quick determination of the use of a caching mechanism.
method.return: true if cache is used, false otherwise

method.name: autoDetectVersion
method.description:
Flag signaling whether the engine should attempt to automatically
determine the version of the received serialized document. This setting
is overridden by specifying a non empty version value when
deserializing the serialized document.
method.return: true if detection is auto, false otherwise

field.name: cacheProvider
field.description:
Reference to an ICacheProvider implementor. Use this field to instruct the engine to use
an object caching mechanism.

field.name: enableLogging
field.description:
Use this flag to control whether to permit logging or not. This is mostly intended for debugging the (de)serialization process.
Logging can slow down the process up to 20 times. Use with caution!

field.name: onlySerializeChangedValueFields
field.description:
Serializing persistable objects can be done by including only the fields
whose values have been changed.

field.name: versionExtractor
field.description:
Reference to a version extractor instance used to determine automatically the version of
an serialized document.

classRec.name: SerializationEvent
classRec.description:
Event being raised by the serialization mechanism in order to signal various stages teh process is in. The event is raised for each complex object/subobject being processed.
There are four types of events one should listen for to hook into the mechanism:
  • preserialize - raised before the serialization of an object begins
  • postserialize - raised after the objet's serialization ends
  • predeserialize - raised before the deserialization of data to an object begins
  • postdeserialize - raised after the deserialization ends
classRec.author: Alexutz

method.name: SerializationEvent
method.description: Constructor
method.param: item current item undergoing the serialization process
source serialized form of the object tree

method.name: createPostDeserializeEvent
method.description: Create a postdeserialize event instance to be raised
method.param: item current object being populated with deserialized data from the data source
source data source document being deserialized

method.name: createPostSerializeEvent
method.description: Create a postserialize event instance to be raised
method.param: source serialized document being generated up to this point

method.name: createPreDeserializeEvent
method.description: Create a predeserialize event instance to be raised
method.param: item current object being populated with deserialized data from the data source
source data source document being deserialized

method.name: createPreSerializeEvent
method.description: Create a preserialize event instance to be raised
method.param: source serialized document being generated up to this point

method.name: object
method.description: Get current object

method.name: parent
method.description: Get current object's parent

method.name: source
method.description: Get serialized document

interfaceRec.name: IFlexXB
interfaceRec.description:
This interface defines a core that handles a specific way of serializing/deserializing
and object. It makes use of a serialization context to inject all the particularities
of a specific serialization format. Also, within the context serializers and converters
are registered.
interfaceRec.author: Alexutz

Event.name: postdeserialize
Event.description: Triggers after the deserialization of a data source into an AS3 object

Event.name: predeserialize
Event.description: Triggers prior to the deserialization of a data source into an AS3 object

Event.name: postserialize
Event.description: Triggers after the serialization of an AS3 object

Event.name: preserialize
Event.description: Triggers prior to the serialization of an object

method.name: addEventListener
method.description:
Add a listener to an event being raised by the serialization process to signal various stages.
There are four stages being signaled through events: preserialize, postserialize, predeserialize and postdeserialize.

method.name: deserialize
method.description: Convert a serialized data (string or byte) to an AS3 object counterpart
method.param: source serialized content to be deserialized
getFromCache get the object from the model object cache if it exists, without processing the serialized data

method.name: processTypes
method.description:
Do an early processing of types involved in the communication process if one
wants to bypass the lazy processing method implemented by the serializer.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.description: Remove a registered listener for a stage event

classRec.name: DescriptionContext
classRec.description:
Description context is the main access point for instructing the engine how to handle a specific serialization format. The context registers annotations, serializers, converters and offers additional methods to assist the registered serializers with the handling of that serialization format. A context also has an instance of a configuration object; as is the case with different formats, additional settings are needed for configuring the mechanism. One may extend the default configuration object to add settings as needed and reference them in the serializers.

This class must be extended if one is to provide a new serialization format support. In subclasses the method performInitialization must be overriden in order to register serializers, annotations and converters.
classRec.author: Alexutz

method.name: DescriptionContext
method.description: Constructor

method.name: getIncomingType
method.description:
Get the object type associated with the incoming serialized form.</br>
Override this method in subclasses because each serialization format has
different ways of determining the type of teh object to be used in
deserialization.

method.name: handleDescriptors
method.description:
Once a new type has been processed, the context has the chance to handle the descriptors in order to construct
internal structures it may need (for example, in handling XML, determine the type by the namespace used).

method.name: performInitialization
method.description:
Override in subclasses to initialize your context by
registering annotations and converters

method.name: registerAnnotation
method.description: Register a new annotation and its serializer. If it finds a registration with the same name and overrideExisting is set to false, it will disregard the current attempt and keep the old value.
method.param: name the name of the annotation to be registered
serializerInstance instance of the serializer that will handle this annotation
overrideExisting override existing registrations under the same name

method.name: registerSimpleTypeConverter
method.description: Register a converter instance for a specific type
method.param: overrideExisting override existing registrations under the same class type

method.name: setApiClasses
method.description: Specify api classes that reflect the defined annotations.

method.description: Get a configuration instance attached to the current description context

method.name: descriptorStore
method.description: Get a reference to the descriptor store

method.name: configuration
method.description: Set a configuration instance attached to the current description context

classRec.name: ObjectPool
classRec.description:
This is the cache for object instances. It maintains a pool for each
object type. It works a bit differently... objects in pool are used
then released to be used by others. While an object is in use it cannot
be reasigned to other. Once the user is done with the instance, it must
call releaseInstance method.
<p/> ObjectPool does not use an id. Objects are assigned baed on the used
state. If all available objects are in use then a new instance will be
created. If there is an object released, it will be passed on for use.
That's why sometimes it is required to clean the objects after use. This
is where the IPooledObject interface comes to use by exposing the clear
method which should be implemented by the objects that require some
cleanup before being reused.
classRec.author: aCiobanu

method.name: ObjectPool
method.description: Constructor

method.name: beginNewSequence
method.description:
Tell the cache the display of the attributes started so it will
at the starting position in the object cache and return object
instances until it runs out. After that new instances will be
created and added in the cache

method.name: releaseInstance
method.description: Mark the view instance as unused

method.description: Easy access instance

classRec.name: FxConstructorArgument
classRec.description:
A constructor argument is a way to say to the FlexXB engine that objects of a certain type
need a special way to be instantiated in the deserialization stage. A constructor argument
is linked to a class field. Usually, when having parameterized arguments, in the constructor
these values are mapped to specific fields within the object.

interfaceRec.name: IDeserializeNotifiable
interfaceRec.description:
Optional interface to be implemented by objects which need specific notification on the deserialization process.
If the current object to be serialized implements this interface, the engine will call the methods implemented on each process step (pre and post deserialize) instead of firing a SerializationEvent on the engine instance for each step.
Implementing this interface overrides the normal event dispatching in the engine.
interfaceRec.author: Alexutz

method.description: Called after the deserialization process of the current object ends.

method.name: onPreDeserialize
method.description: Called before the deserialization process of the current object begins.

interfaceRec.name: ISerializeNotifiable
interfaceRec.description:
Optional interface to be implemented by objects which need specific notification on the serialization process.
If the current object to be serialized implements this interface, the engine will call the methods implemented on each process step (pre and post serialize) instead of firing a SerializationEvent on the engine instance for each step.
Implementing this interface overrides the normal event dispatching in the engine.
interfaceRec.author: Alexutz

method.name: onPostSerialize
method.description: Called after the serialization process of the current object ends.

method.name: onPreSerialize
method.description: Called before the serialization process of the current object begins.

interfaceRec.name: ICycleRecoverable
interfaceRec.description:
Optional interface that can be implemented by FlexXB bound objects to handle
cycles in the object graph.
<p/>Normally a cycle in the object graph causes the engine to throw an error.
This is not always a desired behavior.Implementing this interface allows the
user application to change this behavior.
interfaceRec.author: Alexutz

method.name: onCycleDetected
method.description:
Called when a cycle is detected by the engine to nominate a new
object to be serialized instead.
method.param: parentCaller reference to the parent object referencing the current one
method.return: the object to be serialized instead of this or null to instruct the engine to behave as if the object does not implement this interface.

interfaceRec.name: IPersistable
interfaceRec.description:
Interface defining an object that can be persisted. A persistable object is capable of tracking changes done to it and reverting to initial values if required. IPersistable exposes three methods:
  • modified - check if object has been changed since its last save
  • commit - make changes done from the last save persistent
  • rollback - revert to the initial state of the object
interfaceRec.author: aCiobanu

method.name: commit
method.description: Commit the changes made to the object since the previous commit

method.name: rollback
method.description: Revert all the changes made to the object since the previous commit

method.name: setEditMode
method.description:
Set edit mode.
The editMode flag will cause the object not to issue PropertyChangeEvents whenever one of its fields is changed. This means that components bound to that object will not update to reflect changes in the object because thare are no change events being dispatched from the object. In cases where you would edit the object in a view for example, it would be akward to change the name and see it changed in the background component displaying basic object details. In conclusion, it is not really an edit flag preventing the object from being edited but rather a notifier for the object to turn into a sort of a black box while that flag is active.
method.param: mode boolean value specifing id the flag must be active or not

method.name: startListening
method.description:
Start listening for changes occuring to the object.
Usually called after deserialization completes.

method.name: stopListening
method.description:
Stop listening for changes occuring to the object.
It is usually called before deserialization occurs.

method.name: editMode
method.description:
The editMode flag will cause the object not to issue PropertyChangeEvents whenever
one of its fields is changed. This means that components bound to that object will
not update to reflect changes in the object because thare are no change events being
dispatched from the object. In cases where you would edit the object in a view for
example, it would be akward to change the name and see it changed in the background
component displaying basic object details. In conclusion, it is not really an edit flag
preventing the object from being edited but rather a notifier for the object to turn into
a sort of a black box while that flag is active.

method.name: modified
method.description: Get the object's status: has it been modified since the previous commit?

classRec.name: PersistableObject
classRec.description:
Main implementation of IPersistable. A persistable object is capable of tracking changes done to it and reverting to initial values if required. It should be base for all model objects that need initial state memory capabilities such as IPersistable allows. It uses the methods commit() and rollback() to save the current state or to revert to the previously saved state.

Basically, this object listens for changes to all its public properties and variables and saves the initial value set for that field. Upon commit, the list of initial values is discarded, the new values thus becoming initial values. On rollback, the initial values are reinstated the object returning to the state before eny change had been made.

Note: Subclasses should be decorated with the [Bindable] annotation so all changes to the public fields would be registered.
classRec.author: Alexutz

method.name: PersistableObject
method.description: Constructor

method.name: beforeCommit
method.description:
This is an entry point allowing you to do some computations prior
to commit being executed, that is, before the change list is
discarded.

method.name: beforeRollback
method.description:
This is an entry point allowing you to do some computations prior
to rollback being executed, that is, before the change list is
iterated and changed fields having their values reverted to the
original ones.

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.description: Dispacth the specified event

method.name: exclude
method.description:
Exclude a field from being listened for changes. The object will no longer track changes
that occur to the value of that field.

method.name: hasWatchedFields
method.description: Check if watched fields have been defined for the current object

method.name: isChanged
method.description: Check if the value of a specific field has been changed since the last commit
method.param: fieldName the name of the object's field to check
method.return: true if the field exists and its value has been changed, false otherwise

method.name: isWatched
method.description: Check if an object's field is marked as watched.

method.name: startListening
method.description:
Start listening for changes occuring to the object. Configuring listen mode also propagates to watched fields of tye IPersistable.
It is usually called after deserialization completes.

method.name: stopListening
method.description:
Stop listening for changes occuring to the object. Configuring listen mode also propagates to watched fields of tye IPersistable.
It is usually called before deserialization occurs.

method.name: watch
method.description:
This method allows an object to keep track of changes occuring in its sub-object. In fact it will only monitor the modified status of those sub objects. On rollback or commit it will propagate the commands to those sub-objec it was instructed to watch.

NOTE: Make sure watched objects are also persistable objects

classRec.name: XmlVersionExtractor
classRec.description:
This class is used to determine the version of an incoming document. The version is considerent consistent throughout the entire document and as such the engine will extract it once per received document. By default, the version extractor searches for an attribute named "version".
If you require another kind of processing for versions you should extend this class and override the getVersion method which returns a String and accepts the xml document as source
classRec.author: Alexutz

method.name: XmlVersionExtractor
method.description: Constructor
method.param: versionTagName name of the version tag
isElement boolean flag signaling whether the version is represented as an element or an attribute

method.name: getVersion
method.description:
Method that returns the version string al located in the source xml document. Override this
method to implement different extraction algorithms.
method.return: string value representing the document's version

field.name: escapeSpecialChars
field.description:
Set this flag to true if you want special chars to be escaped in the xml.
If set to false, text containing special characters will be enveloped in a CDATA tag.
This option applies to xml elements. For xml attributes special chars are automatically
escaped.

field.name: getResponseTypeByNamespace
field.description:
Determine the type of the object the response will be deserialised into
by the namespace defined in the received xml.

field.name: getResponseTypeByTagName
field.description:
Determine the type of the object the response will be deserialised into
by the root element name of the received xml.

field.name: getResponseTypeByXsiType
field.description:
Determine the type of the object the response will be deserialised into
by the xsi:type attribute present in the xml element representing the object.

classRec.name: Annotation
classRec.description:
This is the base class for a field xml annotation.

It obtains basic informations about the field:

  • Field name
  • Field type
  • Alias (the name under which the field will be used in the xml reprezentation)

method.name: isVector
method.description:
Function that determines wheather the object passed in is a vector.
Since Flash 10 a new type was introduced, Vector. To keep compatibility with other versions people may use we need to do a special check that would not involve direct linking the Vector class incode.

It takes a single parameter, the object to be checked. If the object is a String, it is considered to be the qualified name of the class and it will get inspected for the vector's qualified name being present. If the object is a class or a plain AS3 object, the getQualifiedClassName method will be used to extract the type name and compare it with the vector's name.
method.param: item item to be checked. Can be anything: class, string, plain object.

method.name: AnnotationFactory
method.description: Constructor

method.name: getAnnotationClass
method.description: Get the annotation class based on the annotation name
method.param: annotationName the name of the annotation

method.name: getAnnotation
method.description: Get the annotation representing the xml field descriptor

method.name: getSerializer
method.description: Get serializer associated with the annotation
method.return: the serializer object or null if the annotation name is not registered

method.name: isRegistered
method.description: Check if there is an annotation with the given name registered in the factory.
method.return: true if an annotation with this name is registered, false otherwise

method.name: registerAnnotation
method.description: Register a new annotation and its serializer. If it finds a registration with the same name and overrideExisting is set to false, it will disregard the current attempt and keep the old value.
method.param: name the name of the annotation to be registered
serializerInstance instance of the serializer that will handle this annotation

method.name: instance
method.description: Singleton accessor
